name: Quentin Dupieux
description:
'''Quentin Dupieux''' ({{IPA|fr|kɑ̃tɛ̃ dypjø}}, born 14 April 1974), also known by his musical stage name '''Mr. Oizo''' ({{IPA|fr|wazo|lang}}), is a French electronic musician, record producer, songwriter, and filmmaker.

Dupieux is credited with his legal name for his films, while the name "Mr. Oizo" is used for his musical works.

Dupieux has directed numerous films including ''[[Rubber (2010 film)|Rubber]]'' (2010), ''[[Wrong (film)|Wrong]]'' (2012), ''[[Wrong Cops]]'' (2013), and ''[[Reality (2014 film)|Reality]]'' (2014). After initially producing his films in the United States, he began making films in France in 2018. Since then, he has released ''[[Keep an Eye Out|Keep an Eye Out!]]'' (2018), ''[[Deerskin (film)|Deerskin]]'' (2019), ''[[Mandibles (film)|Mandibles]]'' (2020), ''[[Incredible but True]]'' (2022), ''[[Smoking Causes Coughing]]'' (2022), ''[[Yannick (film)|Yannick]]'' (2023) and ''[[Daaaaaalí!]]'' (2023) which have been primarily filmed and produced in France.

Under the pseudonym Mr. Oizo, he is best known for his 1999 single "[[Flat Beat]]". His pseudonym is a corruption of the [[French language|French]] {{lang|fr|oiseau}}, meaning "bird". He is signed to [[F Communications]], [[Ed Banger Records]] and [[Brainfeeder]].
